fr.ecp.Group52_Project_IS1220_part1_AVEROUS_TOPUZ.Model.Network.Station

Class Station

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ecp.Group52_Project_IS1220_part1_AVEROUS_TOPUZ.Model.Network.Station.Station
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable, VisitableItems
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StationPlus

    public class Station
extends java.lang.Object
implements VisitableItems, Observable
    Stations are among the most important elements of the myVelib system. A station is where bicycles can be rented and dropped. It consists of a number of parking slots where bikes are stored and of a terminal which users can interact with in order to rent bicycles. Parking slots can be be occupied by a bicycle, free or out-of-order. A station is located in a specific place specified by GPS coordinates. A station can be on service or offline: if it is offline all of its parking bays as well as the terminal cannot be used. There exist two types of stations, a standard type, and a plus type. This class represents the standard type. When a user who holds a Velib card drops a bicycle at a plus station, they earns 5 minutes credits in their time balance. Each station has a unique numerical ID and so each parking slot (within a station) has a unique numerical ID.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pierre Averous, Nicolas Topuz

      • Station

        public Station(Network network,
               int numberOfSlots,
               GPScoordinates location,
               int numberOfBikes,
               float mechanicalBikeProportion)
        throws MoreBikesThanSlotsException,
               InvalidProportionsException
        This method is a constructor of the Station class.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSlots - the number of parkingslots to create in the station, as an int.
        location - the location of the station, as GPScoordinates.
        numberOfBikes - the number of bikes to put on the slots of the station, as an int
        mechanicalBikeProportion - the proportion of mechanical bikes to create, as a float between 0 and 1
        Throws:
        MoreBikesThanSlotsException
        InvalidProportionsException

      • addParkingSlot

        public void addParkingSlot(ParkingSlot ps)
        This method's goal is to add a newly created parking slot to the list of parking slots inside the station. The parking slots within a station will be easier to manipulate if there is an ArrayList of them.
        Parameters:
        ps - the parking slot to add to the list
        See Also:
        ParkingSlot

      • isFreeSlot

        public boolean isFreeSlot()
        This method tells if there is a free parking slot in the station. It checks all parking slots, and returns true if one of them is free, false if there is no spot left to drop a bike.
        Returns:
        true if there is a free spot, false if not

      • getFreeSlot

        public ParkingSlot getFreeSlot()
                        throws NoFreeSlotException
        This method must be used after checking that there is indeed a free parking slot in the station. It then returns the usable parking slot.
        Returns:
        a free parking slot in the station
        Throws:
        NoFreeSlotException

      • isAvailableBicycle

        public boolean isAvailableBicycle()
        This method tells if there is an available bicycle in the station. It checks all parking slots, and returns true if one of them has an available bicycle, false if there is none.
        Returns:
        true if there is an available bicycle, false if not

      • isAvailableBicycle

        public boolean isAvailableBicycle(BikesType type)
        This method tells if there is an available bicycle of type type in the station. It checks all parking slots, and returns true if one of them has an available bicycle, false if there is none.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of bike to check upon.
        Returns:
        true if there is an available bicycle, false if not

      • getAvailableBicycle

        public ParkingSlot getAvailableBicycle()
                                throws NoAvailableBikeException

        Returns:
        a parking slot with an available bike in the station
        Throws:

      • setState

        public void setState(boolean isOn)
        This method allows to define if a station is online or offline. If it is online, the state should be set to true. Otherwise, if the station is offline for a reason or another, the state should change to false.
        Parameters:
        isOn - true if the station should be set to online, false if it should be set to offline.
